article.headline: Nevada 84, SMU 74
article.story: RENO, Nev. (AP) -- Kirk Snyder scored a career-high 33 points and Nick Fazekas added 20 of his career-best 22 in the second half to lead Nevada past SMU 84-74 Saturday night. Snyder made 11 of 15 shots from the field and Fazekas 9 of 11 for the Wolf Pack (9-4, 3-1 Western Athletic Conference), who shot 61.5 percent for the game. With the win, Nevada opened the season with a 7-0 record at home for the first time since the 1984-85 season. Bryan Hopkins scored 25 points and Eric Castro added 15 for the Mustangs (7-6, 1-2). Fazekas scored 14 points in the first 8 minutes of the second half. He also grabbed a game-high nine rebounds for Nevada, which never trailed. Nevada led 38-30 at halftime and widened the lead with a 6-1 run early in the second half. SMU pulled to within 61-55 with 9:10 to play after Hopkins made three 3-pointers in a four-minute stretch, but the Wolf Pack responded with a 16-6 run capped by Todd Okeson's dunk with 5:47 left, making it 77-61. Devon Pearson made a 3-pointer and Hopkins added another to pull SMU within 81-71 at 1:40 to play, but the Mustangs could get no closer. Snyder opened the game with a 3-pointer and a slam dunk to spark a 9-2 run that grew to a 27-15 lead when he hit another 3-pointer with 7:38 to play in the half. Hopkins scored the next 8 points in a row and then Castro converted a 3-point play after he was fouled on a basket inside to cut Nevada's lead to 27-26 at 5:23. But the Wolf Pack followed with another 9-2 run to go ahead 36-28 on a pair of free throws from Snyder at 1:25, and Gary Hill Thomas beat the halftime buzzer with a jumper from the key for a 38-30 lead.
